Forbes • 4/25/2020
You don't need an RTX GPU to access RTX Voice, after all
This app claims to use AI to reduce or outright cancel microphone background noise, and it was only intended to function for RTX card owners. However, as per the usual, the internet has circumvented those limitations. A user over on the Guru3D forums discovered that RTX Voice works "just fine" without a pricey RTX GPU in your system.

Using AI To Build Better Chips

Ironically, one of the approaches being taken is to use AI to help build better AI chips.

HiSense F50 5G debuts with Unisoc chip for 2,199 Yuan (~$310) in China
Coupled with AI algorithm, the quad cameras of the HiSense F50 supports night mode photography, HDR, AI beauty and more. The HiSense F50 is backed by a massive 5,010mAh battery that supports 18W fast charging. The Unisoc T7510 chipset supports SA/NSA dual-mode 5G connectivity. The SoC supports N41, N78 and N79 mainstream 5G frequency bands.
